primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God irrupts into the mundane and sinful lives of humans, provoking holy terror through His holiness, only to immediately resolve that terror through an enabling word of grace and a call to mission.

subject.identificatie: God (The Lord / The Angel of the Lord / Jesus)
tekstueel_bewijs: The angel of the Lord reached out the tip of the staff
God draws near to them both
God must say to us, 'Do not be afraid'
The God who terrifies is also the one who loves us

object.identificatie: The salvation and transformation of the human subject (Grace/Mercy)
tekstueel_bewijs: a small, fleeting moment of grace and mercy has occurred
the awareness of sin comes only to those who are already standing on the firm ground of their salvation

zender.identificatie: The Absolute / The God of Justice and Love
tekstueel_bewijs: The attributes of God toward us are perfect justice and unconditional love

ontvanger.identificatie: The 'messed up' human (Gideon, Peter, the boys in the hospital, the congregation)
tekstueel_bewijs: I bring you good tidings of great joy
the God who terrifies is also the one who loves us for all eternity
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer is positioned as the Receiver (the 'sick patient' in the hospital).

helper.identificatie: Jesus Christ (as the mediator of justice and love) and the 'Enabling Word'
tekstueel_bewijs: the fear is instantly removed by the enabling word 'Fear not'
revealed his conquering love in Jesus Christ
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject; Christ is the Helper/Mediator who resolves the terror.
helper.rol_van_geest: Implicit as the power behind the 'irruption of grace'.

tegenstander.identificatie: Human resistance, sin, and the 'filthy rags' of self-righteousness
tekstueel_bewijs: our Christian cloak as a filthy garment
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Sin is not just a mistake but an ontological state ('unclean lips') that makes the presence of God lethal without intervention.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human response to grace: following and serving (Gideon's battle, Peter's fishing for men).
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Redeemed Human (Peter/Gideon)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (ethics/mission) only begins after the primary program (grace/fear-not) has established the subject's competence.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.subject_naar_object: God → The Redemption of the Sinner

voorbeelden_god_subject: God the Father is definitively revealed
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We don’t want to be loved unconditionally

voorbeelden: We should all be wearing crash helmets
We want to feel that we are deserving of love
The fear of God is the beginning of wisdom
has power to make our resistance go up in flames

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on God's power (Pouvoir) to overcome human incompetence and the 'enabling' nature of the Word.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: The sermon moves from ~S1 (blandness) to S2 (terror) to S1 (grace), showing that S1 is only meaningful through the experience of S2.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved in Christ, where Justice (S2) and Love (S1) meet, consuming human resistance.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; the sermon argues that without the 'dread' of God, grace is not grace.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. God is the primary actor who initiates contact, provides the sign, and speaks the word that transforms the hearer from a state of terror to a state of mission.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as Subject of active verbs
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God demonstrates his freedom, condescending to Gideon’s youth.
The God who is really God is opposed to us... our impurity is his perfection.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Gideon and Peter are not presented as heroes to emulate, but as incompetent receivers of divine irruption.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides a theocentric reading: God chooses the 'nonentity' and the 'sinful man'.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and awe; the hearer is 'messed up' but loved by a God who has the power to save.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic grace; salvation is an 'irruption' from outside the self.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The narrative programs are perfectly integrated: the 'terror' of the primary program is the necessary precursor to the 'wisdom' and 'mission' of the secondary program.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Perfect justice and unconditional love are combined in the person of Jesus Christ, who was hastened to his horrific public death.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The 'Word' acts as the endowment of competence (Pouvoir).

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical; sin is a 'filthy garment' that cannot stand before the 'thunder of the Last Judgment'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God as the Subject. The narrative engine is driven by the tension between God's holiness and human sin, resolved by Christ.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain current balance as it serves the 'Grace' orientation.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The opponent (sin/holiness gap) is already sufficiently intensified.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a masterclass in maintaining the 'Grammar of Grace.' It avoids the trap of making the hearer the hero of their own sanctification.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: A rhetorical analysis might focus on the 'Birds' anecdote; Greimas shows that the anecdote functions as a semiotic mirror of the Gospel's actantial structure.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Midianites; Greimas explains why Gideon's fear is structurally necessary for the 'Fear Not' to function as a modal endowment.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'Fear of the Lord' is not a theme but a structural 'Opponent' that God-as-Subject must overcome to reach the Object (the Sinner).

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'Santa' and 'Birds' stories not as moral examples, but as actantial parallels to divine irruption.
